definition: to eat and drink as much as one likes/to make a pig of oneself
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to drink/variant of 嗬[he1]
to shout

sentences.english: His followers did not carouse, like the troops of many warlord armies.
sentences.chinese: 他的部下也不象许多军阀的军队那样大吃大喝。

sentences.english: Peoplepig, busily preparing for the Spring Festival after eating and drinking.
sentences.chinese: 人们杀猪宰羊，忙碌地准备着春节大吃大喝一番。

sentences.english: Half of two-hour period empress, all talented persons stopped eating greatly to greatly nectar.
sentences.chinese: 半个时辰后，所有人才停止了大吃大喝。

sentences.english: A satisfying dinner will help you avoid a late-night pigout.
sentences.chinese: 一个顿满意的晚餐可以帮你避免晚上的大吃大喝。

sentences.english: Large meals can make you drowsy.
sentences.chinese: 大吃大喝会让你昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: They habitually gorged to the bursting point on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 他们每到星期天总要大吃大喝，直到快把肚子胀破。

sentences.english: She guzzled away all her money.
sentences.chinese: 她把她的钱财都大吃大喝光了。

sentences.english: He made a real pig of himself at the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 他在餐厅里大吃大喝，真丢脸。

sentences.english: Archaeologists consider feasting to be more than just sitting down to eat a lot of food.
sentences.chinese: 考古学家们认为宴会不仅仅是坐在一起大吃大喝。

sentences.english: She pigged out like he hasn't eaten for 3 days.
sentences.chinese: 她大吃大喝的好像三天没吃饭。

sentences.english: People kill pig to kill sheep, busily preparing a Spring Festival belly-worship.
sentences.chinese: 人们杀猪宰羊，忙碌地准备着春节大吃大喝一番。

sentences.english: The poor starve while the rich feast.
sentences.chinese: 穷人挨饿，而富人在大吃大喝。

sentences.english: At the party some were singing and dancing while others were feasting.
sentences.chinese: 该宴会上有些人又唱又跳，有些则是大吃大喝。

definition: to eat and drink gluttonously/to pig out
to stuff oneself with food
to gorge oneself with food
dishes with generous amounts of meat and fish/lavish meal
to eat and drink/food and drink
to gobble up/to gorge oneself on (food)
to eat and drink unreasonably
to drink (alcohol)
to go hungry/to starve
to chew on a large slab (idiom); a large mouthful is hard to chew/to tuck into a great meal
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
to have eaten and drunk to one's heart's content
to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
to gorge oneself/to eat heartily (idiom)
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
